alert.note: Alert for Blue Earth; Faribault; Freeborn; Martin; Steele; Waseca (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Ice Storm Warning issued January 01 at 11:36PM CST until January 04 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: .A winter storm will cause travel impacts starting late tomorrow, and lasting into Wednesday. The worst conditions will be Tuesday morning and early afternoon. On Monday evening a wintry mix of rain, sleet, and ice will develop across southern Minnesota. Some locations may see over a quarter of an inch of ice, and an Ice Storm Warning is in effect. On Monday night heavy snow will move into southwest Minnesota, and spread across central Minnesota and western Wisconsin Tuesday morning into early Tuesday afternoon. Snowfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour are likely for a few hours, which will cause significant travel impacts as visibility drops to a quarter mile at times do to the heavy snow. A Winter Storm Warning is in effect for this heavy snow, with generally 6 to 10 inches expected, with isolated amounts over a foot possible. Elsewhere, a Winter Weather Advisory is in effect for areas that will see a wintry mix, and less snow. Please adjust your travel plans for Tuesday if possible. ...ICE STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM MONDAY TO MIDNIGHT CST TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Significant icing expected Monday night changing over to snow on Tuesday. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches and ice accumulations near a quarter of an inch. * WHERE...Portions of south central Minnesota. * WHEN...From 6 PM Monday to midnight CST Tuesday night. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions will impact the Tuesday commute.
info.instruction: Travel is strongly discouraged. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Prepare for possible power outages. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Road conditions can also be found at 511mn.org for Minnesota or 511wi.gov for Wisconsin.
